prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: there is a painless black growth on my knee what could this be

PATIENT: hi doctor I am a 56 year old male on the left knee there is a painless black growth and that has been there for around years now in a recent visit my doctor advised to use lactic acid plus salicylic acid based topical lotion this reduced the size of the growth a little bit however after stopping the lotion for 15 days it grew back to its original size again but it did not become bigger than before I have attached the pictures for your reference could you please advice as what this could be also what treatment would one need for this

DOCTOR: hi for further doubts consult a dermatologist online

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I am diagnosed with ulcerative proctitis and suppositories do not work for me why

PATIENT: hello doctor I am 26 years old I was diagnosed with proctitis stage of ulcerative colitis in january doctor prescribed mesalamine suppositories and I was healed it again started in may doctor prescribed me three mesalamine suppositories a day but the bleeding still continues any advice on medicine or diet will be highly appreciated

DOCTOR: hello I can imagine how upset you are about your disease thankfully it is limited to the rectum and not extensive to involve the left side of the colon I am sure that your previous gastroenterologist had done biopsy of the rest of colon to exclude microscopic activity in other segments of the colon so if suppository is not working I suggest you to use mesalamine enema you can use grams enema once a day preferably in morning after passing the first stool not thrice a day the once a day dose work fine actually suppositories may not reach up to the extend of disease hence in such situation enema which are rather liquid preparation would work fine plus you should add hydrocortisone enema 100 my once daily at night time you can use hydrocortisone enema for two weeks and mesalamine enema regularly the picture you uploaded suggestive of blood with lots of mucus I also want to recommend to test stool for difficile antigen and blood ha titers for histolytica if any of those infections are found would require antibiotic therapy in addition to the above therapy you can follow up with me and update me about five days of use of the above regimen I hope you would be fine by then I would tell you the long term management of your disease and when exactly you require a repeat colonoscopy I hope this helps ulcerative proctitis stool for fecal calprotectin stool for difficile antigen and blood ha titers for histolytica infection colitis superimposed ulcerative proctitis follow up within one week to update about the symptoms and discuss the investigation that are suggested

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I am feeling feverish due to abdominal pain stomach burn and headache please help

PATIENT: hi doctor I am suffering from abdominal pain for the past two months I have done tests like it scan stool test and blood test now I am feeling feverish headache stomach burn and severe pain

DOCTOR: hello it would have been great if you could have shared the report of it scan and blood tests to tell you about your problem the symptoms you mentioned can be due to various causes namely peptic ulcer disease irritable bowel syndrome small intestinal bacterial overgrowth and many others for now I suggest you to take capsule esomeprazole 40 my once daily before breakfast since you have pain which seem to be secondary to peptic ulcer disease or acidity

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: I have persistent dizziness when standing up suddenly

PATIENT: Hello doctor I am a 32 year old female experiencing dizziness and lightheadedness whenever I stand up quickly from sitting or lying position. This has been happening for about 3 months now and sometimes I feel like I might faint. The dizziness lasts for about 10-15 seconds then gradually improves. I don't have any hearing problems or ear pain. I did check my blood pressure at home and it was 110/70 when sitting and dropped to 90/60 when standing. I'm otherwise healthy and take no medications. Could you please advise what might be causing this and what I should do about it?

DOCTOR: Hello what you're describing sounds like orthostatic hypotension which is a form of low blood pressure that occurs when standing up from sitting or lying down. The sudden drop in blood pressure reduces blood flow to your brain causing the dizziness symptoms. This can be caused by dehydration anemia or autonomic nervous system issues. I recommend you increase your fluid intake to at least 2-3 liters daily and add more salt to your diet unless you have hypertension. When getting up do it slowly - sit first for a minute then stand. Compression stockings might help improve blood return from your legs. If symptoms persist after two weeks of these measures please consult for blood tests to check for anemia thyroid function and electrolyte levels. You might need a tilt table test to confirm the diagnosis if simple measures don't help.

STATUS: low severity
